title: Effetti Digitali Italiani
description:
Embarking on a mission to transform EDI's (Effetti Digitali Italiani) outdated website, our team set out to craft a digital showpiece for this Milan-based visual effects giant, famed for work with Disney, Marvel, and other big names. Our tools for this creative venture? A blend of WordPress, enhanced by Typescript, PHP, SCSS, and the ingenious use of ACF for smooth BackOffice data handling.

The goal was clear: create a site that's not only a feast for the eyes but also a magnet for potential clients and top-tier talent. Among our triumphs was mastering a custom search functionality â€“ a notorious challenge in the WordPress universe.

Another major feat? Seamlessly integrating over 1,500 projects into the website, ensuring each one was showcased in all its glory. The result is a website that mirrors EDI's reputation for breathtaking visual effects, now reflected in a digital space where every pixel and line of code captures the audience's imagination.

title: Romeo e Giulietta
description:
For Romeo e Giuglietta, a catering company known for its unique locations, our mission was to design a website that elegantly showcases their services and venues. The project involved creating a user-friendly and engaging platform using WordPress. We focused on a clean and inviting design, ensuring that visitors could easily access information about the company, their diverse catering services, and the charming locations they feature.

Employing technologies like JavaScript, SCSS, and ACF, we crafted a website that not only narrates the brand's story but also visually represents their distinctive style and culinary excellence. The result is a simple yet captivating online presence, inviting users to explore the gastronomic and aesthetic delights Romeo e Giuglietta offers.
